abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is highly likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; World Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. Among the lessons learned from this project
            were the following: Project design should be well balanced.
            Pilot testing before country-wide roll out is important to
            ensure success of comprehensive reforms. Coordinating
            assistance for European Union acceding countries is critical
            at the preparation stage. Full involvement and ownership of
            the Government in project preparation is essential for its
            success. Establishing oversight mechanisms is essential at
            the implementation stage. The sustainability of information
            technology (IT) programs hinges on risk management:
            Continuity of staff is important during the life of the
            project. Institutional development projects require greater
            supervision budgets than typical investment projects.
